text: hey guys it's angel today I'm excited to
share with you my grandma's homemade
turnip cake recipe in Taiwanese we call
this type out quick but if you're in a
dim sum restaurant and you're trying to
order this dish
you should probably say in a mandarin
local gone now lucky for us my grandma
makes a super yummy turnip cake so if
you learn how to make this you may not
need to or want to order this again so
let's get started for this recipe we
will need 1 pound of rice flour I've got
a bag here that's 16 ounces and it's got
an elephant logo on the front so if
you're out shopping for rice flour buy
this brand
my grandma says it's the best one or
this dish I don't question her so today
we are using this we'll also need 2
pounds of turnip or daikon radish 3
tablespoons of dried shrimp which I've
reconstituted in water earlier we'll
need to mince that up we'll also need 3
Chinese sausage which will dice and 1
tablespoon of dried shallots we'll also
need 1 teaspoon each of soy sauce salt
and sugar and finally 1/2 a teaspoon of
white pepper first start by dicing the
Chinese sausage into smaller pieces then
mince the dried shrimp peel the radish
then carefully begin to grate
here's an angel tip this recipe calls
for two pounds of turnip but I bought a
little more than two pounds so I don't
have to grind it all the way down save
the fingers next let's mix the batter in
a large mixing bowl add the bag of rice
flour salt sugar soy sauce and white
pepper slowly begin to stir and add 2
cups of room-temperature water into the
mixing bowl keep adding the water a bit
at a time until everything's fully
dissolved one thing to call out here is
that I did include whatever water we
used for soaking the dried shrimp
earlier this will help enhance the
flavors of the dish so that's 2 cups of
liquid in total once the batter is fully
mixed in it should look super smooth
like this now let's cook in a saucepan
boil 2 cups of filtered water with all
of the graded turnip we'll want to cook
it for about 10 minutes or so until it's
fully softened and done while we're
waiting let's start another burner and
preheat a nonstick pan saute the Chinese
sausage for a few minutes until slightly
Brown then add the shrimp and shallots
and cook for another minute when that's
finished cooking transfer it to a plate
and set aside
now back to our turnips the best way to
test for dentists is to do a quick taste
test you'll know when it's done once you
taste it
yep it's okay and done now adjust the
heat to a very low setting and add and
stir in the sausage mixture and then our
batter
work quickly to ensure everything is
mixed in as it will thicken up very fast
once it's stickin turn off the heat and
remove it from the stove
next prep a container for steaming I'm
using a light coating of nonstick
cooking spray then transferring the
batter to an a by 8 inch glass container
now this recipe just happens to be the
right amount to fill one a by 8 inch
Pyrex which is great because that's a
pretty common sized container when
you're almost done smooth and flat in
the top then prepare a steamer and steam
for 25 to 35 minutes until it's set and
firm when it's time insert a toothpick
or knife to check for doneness it should
come out fairly clean just note that our
turnip cake will firm up more after it
cools when it's ready remove the cake
and let it cool completely before
cutting it usually takes about an hour
or so or you can let it cool and
refrigerate it for cooking the next day
just so we don't have to wait I have a
batch that I cooked up last night and
pre cut into squares see
as the final step we'll need to pan fry
these squares for an additional 5 to 8
minutes on each side or until they're
golden brown once they're done serve
them hot and garnish with some green
onions so this is my herbal turnip cake
recipe let's try it a little square here
I'm going to add a little soy sauce some
chili sauce maybe put a little onion on
top
it's really good savory and I love the
bits of Chinese sausage that we put in
there if you guys liked this video don't
forget to like and give me a thumbs up
also if you happen to try this recipe at
home please take a photo for me I would
love to see how this recipe turned out
for your home just tag me on social

grinding the dico
